result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob D Bierer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of supervision.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Do not frequent any taverns, bars, or liquor stores. May go to grocery stores that sell alcohol but may not purchase alcohol. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without agent approval. Must comply with all requirements of the sex offender registry. No computers or devices that allow access to the Internet without agent approval. No adult pornographic sites. May not use or possess any pornography.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Jacob D Bierer in court with attorney Mark Francis Nielsen.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. TRANSCRIPT FILED 05-18-2015/tk
The State indicates Ch. 950 does not apply in this case. The Court has reviewed PSI as well as the documents submitted by Mr. Nielsen. Parties have reviewed PSI. The State notes a difference in interpretation of the statute in the PSI and places same on the record. The State recommends 6 yrs WPS bifurcated as 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES with approp conditions.

BTC: Total sentence is 6 yrs WPS bifurcated as 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES/CFTS

For Day Out

ALONG WITH $7,500.00 SIGNATURE BOND. CT 1: 948.12(1m) and (3)(a).  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  No contact with any minors.  No use of the internet. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 03-06-2015: DEFENDANT IS ALLOWED TO GO TO LANDMARK CREDIT UNION ON HIS WAY HOME FROM COURT TODAY TO ATTEND TO PERSONAL BUSINESS.
